name: dissenting
content:

Add to word list
showing a strongly different opinion on a particular question, especially an official suggestion or plan, a legal decision, or a popular belief: dissenting voice There was only one dissenting voice . In the end, the bill sailed through both houses without a dissenting vote. See
dissent
More examplesFewer examplesThere were a few dissenting voices.He said that Republicans needed to be tolerant of dissenting views on those issues if they wanted to retain the White House. The dissenting judge argued that the state constitution was not binding in this case.The dissenting judgments of Lords Hoffman and Hope make compelling reading.
